ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How often these statements applied to your relationship with your relative. Before the dementia: If they were feeling bad, I tried to cheer them up.
How often these statements applied to your relationship with your relative. Before the dementia: When they had a need, they turned to me for help.
How often these statements applied to your relationship with your relative. Before the dementia: I enjoyed helping them.
How often these statements applied to your relationship with your relative. Before the dementia: I went out of my way to help them.
How often these statements applied to your relationship with your relative. Before the dementia: When making a decision, I considered their needs and feelings.
How often these statements applied to your relationship with your relative. Before the dementia: They seemed to enjoy responding to my needs.
How often these statements applied to your relationship with your relative. Before the dementia: They did things just to please me.
How often these statements applied to your relationship with your relative. Before the dementia: They went out of their way to help me.
How often these statements applied to your relationship with your relative. Before the dementia: They responded to my needs.
How often these statements applied to your relationship with your relative. Before the dementia: They would have done almost anything for me.
Mutual Communal Behaviors Scale (MCBS) - Total Score
